data.title: Supporting Arts Grants for Bridgeport
data.text:
Bridgeport is receiving supporting arts grants for several local organizations. These organizations are:

City Lights & Company

Clementina Arts Foundation, Inc.

Downtown Cabaret Theatre Company of Bridgeport

Greater Bridgeport Symphony Society

Kids Empowered by Your Support, Inc.

Klein Memorial Auditorium Foundation, Inc.

Metro Arts Studio, Inc.

Neighborhood Studios of Fairfield County

WPKN, Inc

The Supporting Arts Grant program from the Department of Economic Development provides general operating support to help Connecticutâ€™s arts organizations and municipal arts departments cover programmatic costs associated with their mission-related work. This type of grant is flexible and gives the grantee the ability to use the funds where they are most needed.

This will help our diverse and vibrant art community bring plenty of culture to our area.

This new registered apprenticeship program is the first of its kind in the state and will ramp up the capacity and quality of home-based child care with a new class of expert instructors. Don't forget - registered apprentices earn while they learn!

Check the state OEC website for updates on how to apply: ctoec.org

It's so great to see that such a small change had such a big impact this year.

Plus, SNAP enrollees are also automatically eligible for other federally-funded services including the National School Lunch and Breakfast Program, Head Start, and the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program!

I encourage you to take a second look at whether you can benefit from SNAP under these new revisions. Learn more at www.ct.gov/snap.
